III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff threatened to put a bullet in youth's head.
Investigation On 9/18/24 Complainant reported Youth A returned to the facility
from AWOL on 9/15/24. Youth A had a BB gun in his possession.
Youth A alleged that Staff 1 threatened to put a bullet in Youth A’s
head. Youth A then left the facility. Staff 1 followed in his vehicle,
pulled alongside Youth A, and threatened him again. This incident
was not observed by Complainant. The information was reported
to Complainant by Youth A. Attempts were made to contact
Complainant on 9/19/24, 10/4/24 and 10/21/24.
Interviews:
Chief Administrator was contacted by email on 9/20/24. Chief
Administrator provided incident reports and clarified that Youth A
returned from AWOL with a BB gun on 9/17/24, not 9/15/24.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 9/20/24.
Youth A recalled returning to the facility with a BB gun a few days
prior. Youth A reported that Staff 2 took the gun from him and
threw it on the ground. Staff 2 did not say anything or make any
threats toward Youth A, when he took the gun. Youth A stated no
other staff or youth were there. When asked if any staff made
threats towards him, Youth A stated staff never threatened him.
Youth A did not have any concerns about staff and could not recall
anything else about the incident. Youth A stated that Staff 1 was
not present during the incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 9/20/24.
Staff 2 stated that he was present on 9/17/24 when Youth A
returned from AWOL with a BB gun. Youth A pointed the gun at
Staff 2 and pulled the trigger. Staff 2 was unsure if the gun was
empty or broken, but he did not feel any BBs hit him. Staff 2
stepped forward and grabbed the gun from Youth A. Youth A
became upset, but Staff 2 spoke with him about the dangers of
pointing guns at people. Staff 2 was able to talk and joke with
2

Youth A and diffuse the situation. Staff 2 did not recall seeing Staff
1 interact with Youth A that night. No other staff or youth were
present during the situation.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 10/4/24.
Staff 1 reported he was not present on the night of 9/17/24 when
Youth A returned to the facility with a BB gun. However, Staff 1
was called for assistance and arrived after Staff 2 had already
diffused the situation and Youth A went AWOL again. Staff 1 did
not recall following Youth A in a car. Staff 1 denied making any
threats toward Youth A. Staff 1 did not hear any other staff make
threats toward Youth A.
Documents reviewed
• Youth A’s foster care record was reviewed. Youth A was
placed at the facility on 6/12/24. Youth A was diagnosed
with Autism, Borderline Intellectual Functioning, and ADHD
(combined presentation). Youth A had a history of
obsession with guns and law enforcement. Youth A had
several incidents at the facility where he would act out in
attempt to have law enforcement called to the facility. Youth
A went AWOL twenty-six times since placement and had
more than one incident of returning to the facility with a BB
gun.
• Employee files for Staff 1 and Staff 2 were reviewed. Both
staff were up to date on training. Neither staff had
disciplinary action on file.
• Incident reports:
• 9/17/24 at 11:39am- A peer told Youth A that he had a
BB gun for him if he went AWOL. Youth A walked away
from the building. Staff tried to redirect Youth A to stay
at the building, followed youth on foot, and notified a
supervisor.
• 9/17/24 at 3:24pm- Youth A arrived on site with a BB
gun, brandishing it and pointing it at staff stating he
would shoot staff. Client was high speed. Staff managed
the environment and were able to recover the BB gun
from Youth A. The gun was destroyed. Client was
offered a medical clearance but refused.
Analysis No violation was found as Youth A denied any threats by staff. In
addition, Staff 1 and Staff 2 denied making or hearing any threats
by staff toward Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
